717882f-a.title: Manhattan: Broome Street - Thompson Street.
717882f-a.folder: Broome Street & Thompson Street., Manhattan, NY

717881f-c.title: Manhattan: Broome Street - Thompson Street
717881f-c.text:
No. 1.
Broome Street, east from a point between Thompson Street and West
Broadway (elevated line thereon) and across the latter. It is at this
point that Watts Street branches off, forming a triangular open area
in the foreground. The photograpdhher is technically standing in same
to view northeastward across the Sixth Ave. Elevated line.
May 7, 1938.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
No. 2 \& 3.
A set of two views showina No. 504 and No. 506 Broome Street,
the two buildings appearing on the left of view No. 1. They are
at the N. W. corner of West Broadway and are evidently old resi-
dences converted to commercial use.
View 2: May 7, 1938.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTION1S.  View 3: March 11, 1938.

717883f-a.title: Manhattan: Broome Street - Thompson Street
717883f-a.text:
518, 516, 514, 512, 510 Broome Street, at and adjoning the
N. E. corner of Thompson Street. Nos. 518 and 516 will be demol-
ished inside of six years.
1922.
Eugene L. armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
